intro: Phyllorkis violacea, commonly known as the violet mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, erect stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically purple or violet in color, with a fluffy appearance due to the arrangement of its florets. Phyllorkis violacea thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
